alert.note: Alert for Kahoolawe in Maui (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 28 at 12:51AM HST until January 28 at 4:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: The National Weather Service in Honolulu has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The island of Maui in Maui County * Until 400 AM HST. * At 1251 AM HST, radar indicated locally heavy rain over 1 inch per hour over the slopes of Haleakala. Several streams over east Maui remain elevated. Maui Emergency Management Agency reports that several roads remain closed, including the Piilani Highway near Nuu, South Kihei Road near Kulanihakoi Gulch, and Pulehu Road above the landfill. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding in drainages, streams, rivers, roads, properties, and other low-lying areas. Public road closures possible in some areas. Landslides are possible in steep terrain. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Keanae, Kipahulu, Nahiku, Kula, Kaupo, Makawao, Huelo, Pukalani, Keokea, Haiku-Pauwela, Haliimaile, Hana, Pauwela, Paia, Haleakala National Park, Wailua, Kailua and Hamoa. This warning may need to be extended beyond 400 AM HST if flooding persists. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Stay away from streams, rivers, drainage ditches, and culverts, even if they are currently dry. Do not cross fast flowing or rising water in your vehicle, or on foot. Turn around, don`t drown.
